thread.title: Attorneys: Law forced woman to sue nephew medical bills
thread.title_full: Attorneys: Law forced woman to sue nephew over medical bills - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Attorneys: Law forced woman to sue nephew medical bills
text:
HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) - Lawyers for a New York City woman who sued her 12-year-old nephew for injuring her while excitedly greeting her say Connecticut law forced her to go to court over her medical bills.
A jury on Tuesday rejected Jennifer Connell's lawsuit seeking $127,000. She says she broke her wrist when the Westport, Connecticut, boy jumped into her arms at his eighth-birthday party, causing her to fall.
Connell's law firm says her nephew's parents' insurance company offered her $1 and she had no choice but to sue to pay medical bills. They say she was never looking for money from him.
Peter Kochenburger (KAHCH'-ehn-bur-gur) is an insurance law specialist at the University of Connecticut School of Law. He says state law typically requires those claiming injury to sue the individual responsible.
